section.title: set up a directory to share
section.para: In this second example, we will create a share where everyone can create files and write to files. Again, we start by creating a directory

section.title: configure the share
section.para: Then we simply add a share to our file server by editing smb.conf/etc/samba/smb.conf. Below the check with testparm. (We could have changed the description of the server...)
section.screen:
[root@RHEL52 samba]# testparm Load smb config files from /etc/samba/smb.conf Processing section "[pubwrite]" Processing section "[pubread]" Loaded services file OK. Server role: ROLE_STANDALONE Press enter to see a dump of your service definitions
[global] netbios name = TEACHER0 server string = Public Anonymous File Server security = SHARE
[pubwrite] comment = files to write path = /srv/samba/writable read only = No guest ok = Yes
[pubread] comment = files to read path = /srv/samba/readonly guest ok = Yes

section.title: test connection with windows
section.para: We can now test the connection on a windows 2003 computer. We use the net usenet use(microsoft) for this.
section.screen: C:\>net use L: \\teacher0\pubwrite net use L: \\teacher0\pubwrite The command completed successfully.

section.title: test writing with windows
section.para: We mounted the pubwrite share on the L: drive in windows. Below we test that we can write to this share.
section.screen:
L:\>echo hoi > hoi.txt
L:\>dir Volume in drive L is pubwrite Volume Serial Number is 0C82-272A
Directory of L:\
21/01/2009 06:11 <DIR> . 21/01/2009 06:11 <DIR> .. 21/01/2009 06:16 6 hoi.txt 1 File(s) 6 bytes 2 Dir(s) 13.496.238.080 bytes free

section.title: How is this possible ?
section.para: Linux (or any Unix) always needs a user account to gain access to a system. The windows computer did not provide the samba server with a user account or a password. Instead, the Linux owner of the files created through this writable share is the Linux guest account (usually named nobody).
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 samba]# ls -l /srv/samba/writable/ total 4 -rwxr--r-- 1 nobody nobody 6 Jan 21 06:16 hoi.txt
section.para: So this is not the cleanest solution. We will need to improve this.
